item.title: Least Cost Path for Optimisation on Paths for Power Cables in North Germany
item.description:
Introduction and Objectives

The German power system is adding renewable energy sources in the north, where wind energy plants reach their highest efficiency, due to higher wind speeds. At the same time old power plants e.g. nuclear, hard coal and lignite are being phased out 1. These older power plants were mainly located in southern and central Germany. The energy sink, industrial and private demand, is not shifting north. Therefore, the renewable energy has to be transported from north to south which increases the congestion in the power grid. The amount of offshore wind power, that the German energy system can use, can be greatly increased by adding new power lines 2.
